Module com.example.umlscd
Package com.example.umlscd.BusinessLayer.UseCaseDiagram

Class UseCaseDiagramManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.umlscd.BusinessLayer.UseCaseDiagram.UseCaseDiagramManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class UseCaseDiagramManager extends Object implements Serializable

Use Case Diagram Manager

The UseCaseDiagramManager class is responsible for managing the state and operations of a use case diagram within the UML Editor application. It maintains lists of diagram objects (actors and use cases) and their associations, handles serialization and deserialization for saving and loading diagrams, and provides functionality to export the diagram as an image.

This class leverages Jackson annotations to facilitate JSON serialization, ensuring that the diagram's state can be accurately saved and restored. Additionally, it interacts with the ExportImageService to enable exporting the visual representation of the diagram.

Authors: Ahmad Wyne, Wahaj Asif, Muhammad Muneeb

Version: 1.0

Since: 2024-12-03

  • Constructor Details

    • UseCaseDiagramManager

      public UseCaseDiagramManager()
      Default constructor initializing empty lists for objects and associations.

    • UseCaseDiagramManager

      public UseCaseDiagramManager(ArrayList<UseCaseDiagramObject> objects, ArrayList<Association> associations, String systemBoundaryName)
      Parameterized constructor for initializing the UseCaseDiagramManager with specific objects, associations, and system boundary name.
      Parameters:
      objects - The list of UseCaseDiagramObject instances representing actors and use cases.
      associations - The list of Association instances representing relationships between objects.
      systemBoundaryName - The name of the system boundary for the use case diagram.

    • exportDiagramToImage

      public void exportDiagramToImage(javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas canvas)
      Exports the current use case diagram as an image file.

      This method delegates the export process to the ExportImageService, which handles the rendering of the diagram on the provided Canvas and saves it as an image file.

      Parameters:
      canvas - The Canvas instance representing the visual area of the use case diagram.
